Name:
Wasp class
Wasp
awards: American Defense Service Medal ("A" device) / American Campaign Medal/European-African-Middle Eastern Campaign Medal (1 star) / Asiatic-Pacific Campaign Medal (1 star) / World War II Victory Medal
Fate: Scuttled after attack by the Japanese submarine I-19, 15 September 1942[2]
Displacement:
14,700 long tons (14,900 t) (standard)
19,116 long tons (19,423 t) (full load)
Armament:
8 × 5 in (127 mm) guns
16 × 1.1 in (28 mm) AA guns
24 × 0.50 in (12.7 mm) machine guns
Armor:
1.5 in (38 mm) conning tower
3.5 in (89 mm) side and 1.25 in (32 mm) deck over steering gear
Aviation facilities:
3 × elevators
4 × hydraulic catapults (2 flight deck, 2 hangar deck)
